title: Template-directed oligomerization of 5-prime-deoxy 5-nucleosideacetic acid derivatives
abstract: 5-prime-deoxy 5-nucleosideacetic acids H-II are isostructural analogs of nucleotides with a carboxylate group in the place of the 5-prime-phosphate group. In this work, their oligomerization in aqueous solution was studied using a water-soluble carbodiimide as the condensing agent in the presence or absence of an appropriate polynucleotide template. Condensation of adenylic acid analogs IIa, IIIa, and Va in the presence of polyuridylic acid were found to be the most efficient reactions. Cyclization of the activated monomers to lactones and the insolubility of the oligomers in aqueous solution were found to be obstacles to the efficient formation of long oligomers.

publications.publicationName: Origins of Life and Evolution of the Biosphere
